page.title: 03Appleby New Fair
page.content: The gypsies come to our town once a year in June.This year the gypsies celebrated the three hundredth Fair. Fair hill is the place where they camp. Their caravans are usually long and are decorated with silver plates, chrome,and mirrors.The horses graze on the road verges around Fair Hill. They wash the horses in the river, riding them into the deep water. Many people in Appleby dont like the new fair. During the fair the streets get more crowded and its hard for traffic to get through.The streets also get very dirty and smell horrible thats mostly from the horses.The fair attracts many tourists as well as gypsies. I dont mind them coming much but I think that they could be a bit cleaner and look where they are going on their horses and carts.Dawn Furniss
